nodes.name: Webhook In
nodes.notes:
POST { phrase: string, threshold?: number }
Returns { non_matches: string[], meta: {...} }

nodes.name: Code: normalize_and_ngrams
nodes.notes: Normalize phrase, strip Russian prepositions (keeping - + #), tokenize, and produce 1..3-grams.

nodes.name: Code: explode_candidates
nodes.notes: Explode the array of n-gram candidates into one item per candidate.

nodes.name: HTTP: OpenAI Embeddings
nodes.notes:
Creates an embedding for each candidate n-gram.
- Set your OpenAI credential on this node.
- Batch mode is possible later; this keeps it simple and explicit.

nodes.name: Code: build_vector_literal
nodes.notes: Convert embedding arrays into a pgvector literal (e.g., "[0.1,0.2,...]").

parameters.query:
SELECT v.phrase,  0 - (v.phrase_embedding <#> $1::vector) AS similarity FROM company_content v where company_id=$2
  ORDER BY v.phrase_embedding <#> $1::vector LIMIT 1;

nodes.name: Postgres: vector search
nodes.notes:
Looks up the nearest content phrase using pgvector (<#> = cosine distance if normalized). 
- Assumes table company_content(phrase text, phrase_embedding vector).
- Returns top-1 match with similarity = -distance.

nodes.name: Code: threshold_flag
nodes.notes: Compares nearest match similarity with the threshold and marks pass/fail.

nodes.name: Code: collect_non_matches
nodes.notes: Produces the final response for the Webhook: list of n-grams that have no strong match.

assignments.name: phrase
assignments.value: онлайн школа кодинга для взрослых бесплатно
